question: Which is the top exported seafood from India?
explanation: Fishing in India is a major industry in its coastal states, employing over 14 million people. In past year, the country exported 11,34,948 metric tonnes of seafood worth US$5.78 billion (â‚¹37,870.90 crore), frozen shrimp being the top item of export. According to the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) of the United Nations, fish production has increased more than tenfold since 1947 and doubled between 1990 and 2010.
